text: Hey just a quick one, I'm testing out the posts filters module and I've added it to my html [hubL] file
Is there anyway to live load the results?
Something like this <https://sleeknote.com/blog>
Or do I need to look into <#C22PDRW72|data-driven-content> to do something like this

Hi Community,

I been searching and not sure its possible so wanting to confirm if anyone has ever pulled this off. Is there any hubl available that would pull in the author image in a rss email?Here is an example
I have been having issues with what im calling "Ghost Content"
I will create a module with NO default content and I will see the div or element appear on page until i add ACTUAL content and then remove said content to make it disapear.
Example: <http://4114160.hs-sites.com/-temporary-slug-e7786094-ce31-46d4-a9bf-3b7324487bec?hs_preview=vpOHdvnW-7525729694>
the small white boxes are a third level repeating field that doesnt have any content to be able to output. I am even testing to make sure there are more than 0 and i still see the blank boxes.
I have a lot more of these headers coming and I dont want my client to have to fight this
Any backend help is appreciated
I had to move on, but this is still an issue...
The image may be too big to resize on demand. Try to upload a somewhat smaller version.
Looking
it is working now, <https://cdn2.HubSpot.net/hub/4791627/hubfs/robin-spielmann-1351125-unsplash.jpg?width=600&name=robin-spielmann-1351125-unsplash.jpg>
Awesome! Thanks guys. It's working on my end as well :partyparrot:

hello guys a question

What results does a page of search results from HubSpot show? Does it only return title and description or can it also return images or categories?
yes and yes
You would have to make a template yourself.
<https://designers.HubSpot.com/blog/adding-a-search-results-page-to-your-HubSpot-hosted-site>
Thanks for the help <@U26AKMZ19> and <@UA886MF42> :pray::raised_hands::luke:
thanks
how to load the results page in my blog?

Anyone have any luck modifying blog post read time function? I'd like to have posts that calculate to 0-mins display 1 min... Tried this: `{{ content.post_body|wordcount|divide(300) < 1 ? 1 : content.post_body|wordcount|divide(300) }}` no luck
<@U795QFHDE> try this `{{ content.post_body|wordcount|divide(300) < 1 ? '1 min' : content.post_body|wordcount|divide(300)~' mins' }}`
